Class Boss

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.Group
com.example.demo.actors.Actor.Actor
com.example.demo.actors.Actor.Boss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Boss extends Actor
Represents the Boss enemy in the game. The Boss has unique behavior such as moving in a predefined pattern, summoning shields, firing projectiles, and playing an explosion animation when destroyed.

  • Property Summary

    • Boss

      public Boss(javafx.scene.Group root, LevelParent level)
      Constructs a Boss instance with a specific root group and parent level.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group of the scene graph.
      level - The parent level containing the Boss.

    • initializeHealthBar

      private void initializeHealthBar()
      Initializes the health bar for the Boss and configures its appearance and position.

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor(double deltaTime, LevelParent level)
      Updates the Boss's state during each frame, including position, shield, and shooting behavior.
      Specified by:
      updateActor in class Actor
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time since the last update, in seconds.
      level - The parent level containing the Boss.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Inflicts damage on the Boss if its shield is not active.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class Actor
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage to inflict.

      private void updateHealthBar()
      Updates the health bar to reflect the Boss's current health.

      public void stopShieldTimeline()
      Stops the timeline responsible for checking the Boss's shield status.

    • initializeShieldCheck

      private void initializeShieldCheck()
      Initializes a timeline to periodically check and summon a shield for the Boss.

    • summonShield

      public void summonShield()
      Summons a shield to protect the Boss if it is not already summoning one.

    • initializeMovePattern

      private void initializeMovePattern()
      Initializes the movement pattern of the Boss, defining how it moves vertically.

    • getNextMove

      private int getNextMove()
      Retrieves the next move from the Boss's movement pattern. The pattern is reshuffled after consecutive moves in the same direction.
      Returns:
      The next vertical movement value.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Handles the destruction of the Boss, including playing explosion animations and executing the destruction callback.
      Specified by:
      destroy in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      destroy in class Actor

      public void updatePosition()
